```{r}
#I cleaned letterwinners data and then filtered to exclude NA values in
#concentration column. I then selected concentration and industry to see the
#data next to each other. I'm still playing around with the data, but I think I
#want to plot the correlation between concentration and industry.
letterwinners%>% 
  clean_names() %>% 
  #subset(select = -x6) %>% 
  #subset(select = -x11) %>% 
  filter(concentration != "NA") %>% 
         #industry != "NA",
         #linked_in != "NA",
         #concentration != "NA",
         #secondary_concentration != "NA") %>% 
  mutate(concentration = fct_relevel(concentration, c("Economics",
                               "Government",
                               "Biology",
                               "Neurobiology",
                               "Physics",
                               "Psychology",
                               "History of Art & Architecture",
                               "English",
                               "History"))) %>% 
  mutate(industry = fct_relevel(industry, c("Finance",
                               "Consulting",
                               "Medicine",
                               "Athletics Education",
                               "Education",
                               "Retail, Consumer Goods"))) %>% 
  #group_by(concentration, industry)%>% 
  select(concentration, industry) %>% 
  gt(rownames_to_stub = FALSE)

letterwinners %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = "concentration", y = "industry")) +
    geom_point()

```
